name: Teriyaki Chicken Stir-Fry
author: ANGIEQ
summary: This teriyaki chicken stir-fry is something to make when you just don't know what to cook.
ingredients: ½ cup teriyaki marinade (such as Kikkoman®)
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, cut into 1-inch cubes
½ cup stir-fry sauce (such as Kikkoman®)
directions: Whisk teriyaki marinade, soy sauce, ginger, brown sugar, red pepper flakes, and black pepper together in a large glass or ceramic bowl
Add chicken and toss to evenly coat
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 5 hours
Heat a wok over medium-high heat
Add scallions, garlic, and oil; stir-fry for about 1 minute
Add broccoli, snow peas, and bell pepper; stir-fry for 2 minutes more
Add stir-fry sauce and mix until vegetables are coated
Remove chicken from the marinade and shake off excess
Add chicken to the wok and stir-fry until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes
